title: Fresh clone: bd should suggest 'bd init' when no database exists
description:
On a fresh clone of a repo using beads, running `bd stats` or `bd list` gives a cryptic error:

```
Error: failed to open database: post-migration validation failed: migration invariants failed:
  - required_config_present: required config key missing: issue_prefix (database has 2 issues)
```

**Expected**: A helpful message like:
```
No database found. This appears to be a fresh clone.
Run 'bd init --prefix <prefix>' to hydrate from the committed JSONL file.
Found: .beads/beads.jsonl (38 issues)
```

**Why this matters**: The current UX is confusing for new contributors or fresh clones. The happy path should be obvious.

title: Add multi-session project continuity
description:

- Save/restore session state
- Continue where you left off

- Track project-level context across sessions

This enables 'build something together over multiple conversations' workflows like Claude Code supports implicitly.

title: Update system prompt with TodoWrite guidance
description:
Update efrit-do--command-system-prompt and efrit-do--session-protocol-instructions to guide Claude on using todo_write.

## Changes

Replace all references to the 8 old tools with todo_write guidance:
- Remove: todo_analyze, todo_add, todo_update, todo_status, todo_next, todo_execute_next, todo_get_instructions, todo_complete_check
- Add: todo_write with clear when-to-use guidance

## Guidance Pattern (from Claude Code)

```
Use todo_write when:
- Complex multi-step tasks (3+ steps)
- User provides multiple tasks
- Breaking down large features

Do NOT use for:
- Simple single-action tasks
- Trivial operations
- Pure information queries
```

## Key changes

1. efrit-do--session-protocol-instructions: simplify dramatically
2. Remove all anti-loop messaging (no longer needed)
3. Remove workflow state references

## Acceptance

- [ ] System prompt references todo_write not old tools
- [ ] Clear when-to-use / when-not-to-use guidance
- [ ] No anti-loop warnings in prompt

title: bd doctor should detect fresh clone and recommend 'bd init'
description:
When running `bd doctor` on a fresh clone (JSONL exists, no .db file), it should:

1. Detect this is a fresh clone situation
2. Recommend `bd init --prefix <detected-prefix>` as the fix
3. Show the prefix detected from the JSONL file

Currently it shows various warnings (git hooks, merge driver, etc.) but doesn't address the fundamental issue: the database needs to be hydrated.

title: bd doctor --fix needs non-interactive mode (-y/--yes flag)
description:
When running `bd doctor --fix` in non-interactive mode (scripts, CI, Claude Code), it prompts 'Continue? (Y/n):' and fails with EOF.

**Expected**: A `-y` or `--yes` flag to auto-confirm fixes.

**Workaround**: Currently have to run `bd init` instead, but that's not discoverable from the doctor output.

title: Design TodoWrite-style interface for better task tracking
description:
Replace the current 8-tool TODO system with a single TodoWrite-style tool.

## Why

The current system has:
- 8 separate tools (todo_add, todo_update, todo_analyze, etc.)
- Complex anti-loop infrastructure (workflow state machine, tool call counting, schema filtering)
- Client-side intelligence in todo_analyze (pattern matching on commands)
- Sync issues from incremental state updates

The TodoWrite pattern (used by Claude Code) solves these:
- Single tool, full state replacement each call
- No sync issues, no loops by design
- Pure Executor: Efrit just stores what Claude sends
- Proven pattern Claude already knows

## Scope

- Implement todo_write tool
- Update system prompt guidance  
- UI: *efrit-todos* buffer + mode line
- Delete old tools + anti-loop machinery
- Update docs

## Out of Scope (separate issues)

- ef-t7f: Response detail lost
- ef-9jp: Circuit breaker doesn't terminate session
- ef-a46: session_complete overwrites results

title: Epic: World-class *efrit-agent* buffer for agentic workflows
description:
## Overview
Create a best-in-class agentic session buffer that makes Efrit feel like working WITH an intelligent assistant, not waiting for one.

## Vision
When a user runs `efrit-do` with a complex task, they should see:
- Real-time task progress (not just final results)
- What Claude is thinking and doing
- Ability to interrupt, redirect, or provide input
- Clear error context when things go wrong

## Design Document
See: docs/designs/efrit-agent-buffer-design.md

## Success Metrics
1. During dogfood tests, user can see exactly what Efrit is doing at any moment
2. Task completion is visible before session ends
3. Errors are immediately visible with actionable context
4. User can provide input mid-session without friction
5. The UX is comparable to Claude Code's terminal experience

## Scope
- New `efrit-agent.el` module
- Integration with efrit-progress, efrit-do, efrit-executor
- New faces and rendering for structured display
- Key bindings for interaction

## Out of Scope (for now)
- Multi-session management (separate epic)
- Mobile/terminal-only rendering
- Streaming token display

title: Bug: efrit-do uses one-shot execution instead of agentic loop
description: efrit-do calls efrit-do--execute-command which is one-shot: it sends the command, executes tools once, and returns. It doesn't continue the conversation loop. description:
When running `bd init` in a fresh clone with existing JSONL, it should auto-detect the issue prefix from the JSONL file instead of requiring `--prefix`.

Currently you must specify `--prefix ef` manually. But the JSONL file already contains issues like `ef-1it`, `ef-1jp` etc., so the prefix is known.

**Ideal UX**:
```
$ bd init
Detected issue prefix 'ef' from existing JSONL (38 issues).
âœ“ Database initialized...
```

This would make fresh clone hydration a single command: `bd init` with no flags.

title: Wire efrit-agent buffer to efrit-do/executor lifecycle
description:
## Summary
Integrate the agent buffer with the Efrit execution lifecycle so it automatically appears and updates.

## Requirements
1. Auto-create buffer when `efrit-do` starts multi-step session
2. Hook into `efrit-progress-start-session` for initialization
3. Hook into `efrit-progress-end-session` for completion
4. Register for progress events (tool-start, tool-result, text)
5. Handle session cancellation gracefully

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Buffer appears automatically for complex tasks
- [ ] Buffer updates in real-time during execution
- [ ] Buffer shows final status when session ends
- [ ] Cancelled sessions show appropriate state
- [ ] No orphaned buffers after session cleanup

## Technical Notes
```elisp
;; Hook into session start
(advice-add 'efrit-progress-start-session :after
            #'efrit-agent--on-session-start)

;; Or use a hook if we add one to efrit-progress
(add-hook 'efrit-progress-session-start-hook
          #'efrit-agent--on-session-start)
```

## Open Questions
- Should buffer appear for ALL efrit-do calls or only multi-step?
  Recommendation: Only when TODO list is created (indicates multi-step)

## Dependencies
- Core module
- All section implementations
